website_summaries.verdict: An affordable cooler from a recognized manufacturer. Quality isn't as high as it once was, but it's still the best budget deal.
pros: Solid stainless steel latches remain secure under pressure
cons: Quality not as high as vintage Coleman coolers

website_summaries.verdict: This cooler is a solid model at a nice size that can handle a lot of food and drinks for a weekend away.
pros: Keeps ice frozen for up to four days
It has a nostalgic feel and really stands the test of time
cons: This cooler is a little heavier than others and can make it difficult to handle when full

customer_reviews.title: Solid US made cooler
customer_reviews.text: This thing is SOLID. I didn't need my ice to last a week so this is perfect for a weekend or day trip. The latch is the best feature. 1 gallon water jug for size comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Joemomma

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on a Yeti
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if the same deal is still available, but I purchased this cooler for $55 and it is the purchase of the year hands down. We put a SINGLE bag of ice and some cooling blocks in this beast for a 4-day camping adventure and it still had ice in it at the end!! Seriously, this this is incredible value and the retro look is super swag. I would buy it again if it broke and still feel like I got a deal
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: A True Coleman
customer_reviews.text: Love this cooler. Retro looks with modern technology. The first time we used it was in August...In Louisiana. We left it outside for 4 days and used it, opening and closing the entire time. It still had ice and was still cold. (Did I mention this was August...In Louisiana?). Very nice cooler. A true Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Varnado

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality, Great Size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the same model that I owned for 35 years. There were some small changes (hinges are now stainless steel, not plastic), but overall quality remains outstanding - well done, Coleman! Don't understand the latch issues in some other reviews - it is a great design that can be operated with one hand. This is a 3 day cooler that is of a size that can be filled with food and ice and still be lifted by an old geezer.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool and stays cool!
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a 2 day camping trip and I still had solid ice in it on the drive back. I have to agree with some reviews that the handles are latch feel a lot more flimsy than my parents old mint-coloured coleman icechest and I miss the beer openers on the handles too! Fix this and I'd give it 5-star! Tip: put water in a 9x13 cake pan and freeze it. I used about 4 of those as ice blocks and they fit perfectly in the bottom and along the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Poor seal
customer_reviews.text: Poor construction, there are gaps on the back of the lid when fully closed. I left my phone with the flashlight on inside this photo and you can see the light coming out of the lid and in corners. I can even slid a piece if paper through into the lid without issues. Ice won't last a day with quality like this... returning this product to get something better.
customer_reviews.author: G Chan

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Performance
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this cooler. We took it camping and it did not hold ice for more than 12-14 hours on any of the 3 days we used it. More than 70% of ice melted every 12-14 hours and it had to be refilled. We also followed instructions by cooling it with ice 24 hours prior to using and filling with only previously chilled items. Additionally, on the third day the latch would no longer consistently secure cooler. We finally gave up and used our inexpensive Igloo, which completely outperformed the Coleman on this trip. Unfortunately we are beyond Amazon's 30-day return window.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Panos

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: So far so good took it with me for my 4th of July overnight trip and it worked great I put in about 10-15lbs of ice and left it overnight and here in Texas it was 100+ degrees during the day and 80+ overnight and it had about 40% of the ice left coming home. I added the Coleman light and the magcap bottle opener and it got a ton of compliments and did the job! Oh and I’m regards to people’s comments on the quality of the latch this unit seems solid the latch is plastic but seems to be working as designed. We will see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Color varies
customer_reviews.text: So this ice chest works great! Keeps ice for about a day, maybe two depending on how much is in there. We traveled across the country with it in the backseat and it held up well. Love the locking latch. My only issue is that we ordered black and a blue/aqua was delivered in the picture. I'm not opposed to the color, but you should be aware you may not get what you're expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Latch is a sad joke
customer_reviews.text: The latch is a sad joke on this cooler..Which is the sole reason I bought it.. If it were filled with water and ice and it tipped over the contents would freely spill out of a half inch gap between door seal and body of cooler.Very poor quality..Don’t waste your time like I did.. Just buy a Yeti or a cheap cooler and throw a latch on it..But definitely not this overpriced crap disguised with a cheapo steel belt..Entire unit just feels cheap
customer_reviews.author: Dmonster

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Latch system
customer_reviews.text: The inside of the latch system fell out the second time we used this. It was just a cheap piece of plastic and now the cooler won't lock. Very disappointed as we purchased this based on the fact that it had a good metal latch system.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't latch, pointless.
customer_reviews.text: The cooler doesn't latch. Amazon even sent me a replacement. Still doesn't latch. Don't waste your money. Coleman has gone down the tubes. I'm writing this almost four years after my purchase cause I just found it while cleaning out the garage and needed to share. Don't buy this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy and keeps things cold
customer_reviews.text: When i first got it, it was pretty sturdy and keeps things cold. Only problem was that the paint on the edges of the top scrapes off easily. Now 5 months later, the box and hinges is all rusted and the hinges are off. Very disappoint for the price we paid that this hasn’t lasted well
customer_reviews.author: Viasalutti

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking for another cooler
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this cooler, and was so excited to take it on a camping trip. But...it emailed. For six days, I had to replace 20 pound bags of ice each day because they melted completely. I was camping by myself, so it’s not like the chest was opened by multiple people. There were temperatures that exceeded 90° on one day, but most days were around 70 to 80°F. Nit astronomical, and the cooler should have kept the ice frozen, but instead was a soupy mess each day. It just did not meet expectations. I think it’s more of a novelty and looks vintage and cool, rather than being actually functional.
customer_reviews.author: RebeccaK

customer_reviews.title: A REAL WORKHORSE-CHAPTER 2
customer_reviews.text: We finally retired our last Coleman Steel-Belted after 20+ years! It's still minimally usable, so we donated it to a non-profit arts group. The old one had been through twice-yearly trips to our water access property at a remote lake in Canada. We even "cheated" by buying a large Yeti to use instead; that just didn't work out as the extra bulk & weight was just too much to handle under those conditions. I don't want to bash Yeti, it held ice somewhat longer, but just wasn't the right tool for the job. So, we are looking forward retaining the status quo with our NEW same-old same-old!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bodine

customer_reviews.title: Dollar for dollar, pound for pound, one of the best camping products on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product, Coleman really has the market cornered with their line of coolers. This is hands down the vest value for the money, the plastic ones are nearly as much, not nearly as rugged, or attractive, or insulated. The only thing I wish this had was a locking device, even if it's just a manual lever to lock it in place. The mechanism closes securely, but I suspect critters could get this thing open without too much trouble, especially smart ones like raccoons.
customer_reviews.author: samsonthesaxman

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t wait for it to arrive finally when it did i filled it with ice and drinks to have for work the next day When i got up there was water all over my living room floor. I realized it leaks at the drain plug , not the plug it self but from behind the ring that consists of the plug hole. Maybe i was wrong, Maybe made in China is better. Poor craftsmanship poor quality control Although i was hoping it would be this is definitely not my father’s cooler. I think Coleman needs to move this factory to China
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the vintage look & love it's performance!
customer_reviews.text: Took this camping with temps in the upper 90s and "feels like" temps in the 100s and it held ice for several days! This was our beverage cooler and was opened probably 15 times daily and was left in the bed of the truck. We did purchase another bag of ice on the 3rd day because the 2 bags we had put in there were almost completely melted. Considering the heat & how much this was used, we are super happy!
customer_reviews.author: nurselauren83

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the latch
customer_reviews.text: I loved the old look of this cooler. I was so excited to get this, thinking it would be build like it was back then. Boy was I wrong. The latch on this cooler pops open if you have it filled to the top. It doesn’t latch down like the old ones did. It has two rollers that give way if the cooler is too full. I know packing your cooler too full is not efficient, but the latch pops open if the cooler gets tipped over or bumped hard enough. I was really disappointed only in the latch. Honestly everything else was pretty good. It kept things cold for 4 days, but my ice did melt after two day.
customer_reviews.author: Daylene Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Not a 4 day ice keeper
customer_reviews.text: Just used it for the 4th of July. Kept sodas in it and it was full of ice. Added the sodas and of course some of the ice melted, to be expected cooling down the drinks. Maybe I expect too much but I would have assumed at the 4 day mark being kept in my garage with now cold sodas that there would be more ice than water, exact opposite. At the 4 day mark the cokes were starting to get warm, least they were still cool. Also, the latch screws became loose. I have to tighten them back up. Might be a tad overpriced in my opinion but I happen to like Coleman products and overall happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Clifton

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler, but they need to go back to metal for lid
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT cooler, no doubt. I bought the classic green cooler, and it holds ice (in my estimation) MUCH longer than any Igloo or plastic Coleman I have ever owned. Now, my latch and lid work perfectly, BUT I definitely sympathize with other reviewers. I actually went to a Coleman outlet and checked several of these out before purchasing. I would have just bought at Coleman Outlet, but they did not stock the classic green. Anyway, probably 3 or 4 of the ones I messed around with that were on display had broken lid latches. Sad. So, that's the only reason for 4 stars rather than 5
customer_reviews.author: volfandan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This has gone way down in quality!!!! The lid is VERY loose and doesn’t seal at all. The rotating lock device is absolutely useless as just a little pressure on the lid will make it open despite the lock being in place. Since the lid doesn’t seal ice doesn’t last long. I would have returned/exchanged it if I noticed sooner, but I just used it for the first time this week. It’s sad as my brother has this same one and his is amazing. I did read other reviewers saying quality has gone down, I’d have to agree.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Super Strong and quality built but no food tray!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very heavy duty cooler.It will last FOREVER!!! Very well made.Only FLAW is it doesn't come with a food tray!!!Most coolers this expensive have one.Also Coleman doesn't make one as a accessory.I'm off to the 99c store for a size that will fit.Love the stainless steel!
customer_reviews.author: Boz Hollywood

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgic AND Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I admit it: I bought this cooler for sentimental reasons (my family camped all over the USA with our green model in the ‘60’s and 70’s. The night it was stolen from our campsite on the Wind River of WY it felt like we’d lost a member of the family) and nostalgia—it matches my 1967 Serro Scotty trailer. BUT, it’s also a good, strong functional cooler: ice lasts two/three days (not the 4 mentioned), the latch, drain and bottle opener all work perfectly, and it’s sturdy enough to sit on in a pinch. And, frankly, it looks SO DARNED COOL, people stop and smile. You know you want it! Get it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky L.

customer_reviews.title: At least as good as any other cooler I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: At least as good as any other cooler I've ever used, and seems more durable. Not sure I could pick anything better for less than $100. The only draw back is a lack of handle/wheels. When fully loaded, it'll take a strong person or two people to carry it. Still, the last cooler I had with a handle and wheels fell apart after 5 years, so maybe this'll be better.
customer_reviews.author: Realon

customer_reviews.title: Cool vintage look, but low performer!
customer_reviews.text: If you like the vintage look this is your cooler. There are 2 things that I am disappointed about. First it scratches so incredibly easy and in the description they say 4 days of ice retention....NOPE! Not true! We took it to Oregon it was low 70’s (colder most days) on the best day and the cooler was never in the direct sun and we only found that the ice lasted 1 day and it was mostly water with some ice! So if you want a cooler that is durable and looks cool this is your cooler if you want one that keeps your drinks and food on ice for 4 days like they claim ....don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: FarmGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great cooler. It keeps ice for days and is built very sturdy. I have the cooler located in my passengers seat and it’s a fine table area with non-slip mesh. That being said, I’m a trucker and was going to attach items via magnets to the “steel-belted” stainless steel model I purchased because it’s efficient use of metal sides. Any way, I bought awesome magnets, but they aren’t attracted by this mix of metal. Yes, I know there are many various mixes of metal, but when they call it “steel-belted” and stainless steel ... oh well. It’s still a great cooler, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good Cooler - Coleman Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooler because we had these during my camping days whey back when. It has a sturdy design and looks great with the retro looks. The handle, latch and hinges seem strong so I expect a long life. However the only thing I feel is incorrect is the claim that ice will last 4 days in 90 degree temperatures which is really a stretch by Coleman's advertising. I keep mine in the garage which is shaded and the best I get is two days or so with unbroken ice. Not that that is an issue, because it last a weekend which is good enough for me. I love the look, brings back many memories.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fitz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this. I was replacing and old plastic Coleman cooler that I camped with for many years. I Took this new one camping for the first time this week and it doesn’t keep ice frozen, temps have only been in the high 70’s. Every morning I would open it to find the drinks in water. Every day added more ice. Guess I will have to try some other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M. Fair

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but...
customer_reviews.text: Looks fantastic in the stainless steel, but the lid doesn't really seal tight and the latch doesn't really hold it close tight. It just kinda stops it from coming open. Looks wise, it's first rate. But if you want to actually keep items cold there are better products at better prices.
customer_reviews.author: Mada H. Tims

customer_reviews.title: Ice doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: Love to retro look! But plan on throwing ice in it daily. We are at day 5 at the beach with our new cooler. We have bought a 20 pound bag of ice daily. Cooler is on the deck in the shade. Bag of ice lasts 12 hours at the most. The latch that’s suppose to pull the lid down tight doesn’t. Wish I could contact Coleman directly. Very unhappy, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work for summer weather.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this cooler. Loved the design but in all reality it doesn't preform the way I had hoped. Even in the cooler weather it would hold the ice for 2 days at most. Now that it's getting hotter, I am looking for something else to replace it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tyduckycody

customer_reviews.title: Latch broke on second trip
customer_reviews.text: Used this on two camping trips, about three days each. At the end of the second trip the latch broke off. Now a good wind while it's in the back of my truck will flip the lid open. This cooler looks sturdy and retro cool, but the latch and other parts are cheap plastic. I'm already past the refund date so I'm stuck with it. Sad trombone.
customer_reviews.author: anoneemouse

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of buying cheap coolers and wanted something that would keep things cold for our two day trips, back and forth, while moving. This has worked out good. I bought two thick big paks to freeze (about 1 1/2 inches thick and almost 8x11 in size) I place them in the bottom and put our beverages on that and then our sandwiches/snacks and they stay cold for the two day trip back and forth. (Michigan to Florida) This is a quality product and it can take abuse until the last two I went through and accidentally dropped out of the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Burton

customer_reviews.title: Classic look m, but disappointing performance.
customer_reviews.text: The latch is worthless and consequently it does not stay airtight. Thought I could avoid buying a YETI with a better Coleman. Ended up with both now. I use this to keep dry food from getting wet/too hot, but if longterm cold is what you want, skip this and get a YETI/Pelican, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W. Churpek

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size and style
customer_reviews.text: Grew up with Coleman products and this one definitely brought back fond memories of the ole green Steele belt my dad hauled around on family trips across the USA and halfway around the world. My friend bought a similar sized Yeti that’s really nice but a little more bulky, heavier, and way more expensive. I think he was a lil wee jealous of my Coleman, plus, my is way more prettier. I’m glad Coleman when back to old school and not just pumping out the all plastic junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy S

customer_reviews.title: Cooler:  You had ONE JOB.
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. I love the retro looks of this cooler (I bought it to replace a 1970's Thermos cooler I loved and used for decades). It looks like a quality product. The problem? It doesn't keep things cool. It is probably fine to bring to a picnic for an afternoon, but forget camping: Ice melts within an hour. I don't even think it would hold up to a day at the beach. Unfortunately, I purchased it in June and didn't use it until just this past Labor Day Weekend--too late to return it, otherwise it would definitely be going back.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly K.

customer_reviews.title: Another great Coleman classic to add to ur camping collection.
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooler And definitely recommend! Classic 1970’s vintage steel belt look brought back to life. Keeps food and drink cold for days in the Oregon summers 80 -100 deg days. I chose this cooler over other brands like Yeti and Grizzly only because I love and trust Coleman brand love the classic vintage look with the steel warp around and not it is not as heavy as those other Bulky coolers for when ur climbing down cliff sides or trails to get to ur campsite.
customer_reviews.author: Bensquared

customer_reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLY AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: I order this cooler by Coleman because I know them to be a reputable brand. I took the cooler camping and my ice didn't even last the first 24 hours. I then contacted them for a replacement which they obliged and the second cooler was just as bad. I contacted them for another replacement and for the 3rd I asked for the chromed cooler. Each one was equally awful. You can even tell the cooler sucks because when you open it there is no suction what so ever. What an embarrassing waste of time and materials, I've given them all away, absolute trash.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Pistorino

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built, holds a lot
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built, holds a lot, and will work great for our needs since we didn't want to pay the cost of a Yeti or RTIC. The lock was very easily broken, though, and broke on our first day of using the cooler. The cooler kept the ice for a total of about 15 hours (outdoors in the heat and being opened repeatedly). For the cost, it's a great cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cooler
customer_reviews.text: We use this camping, and it's a fantastic, solid cooler. It kept our ice from melting for almost three days in 100+ degree heat during a recent trip - that was impressive. It was HOT outside and this cooler was under the RV doing its job! I don't have a Yeti or fancy cooler to which I could compare this, but I assure you we are very happy with our Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: BB in ATL

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Latch Plate On Lid = Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Coleman has apparently replaced the metal latch plate (in the lid) with plastic. This will break VERY easily. Two or three good tugs to see if lid is unlocked will kill this part. Spend your money elsewhere. Once this part breaks, even the replacements are just as flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T.

customer_reviews.title: Real pretty - pretty leaky.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this cooler in the dark green, and while it looks so pretty, it also leaks. I put a bunch of ice in it for a party, and noticed that it was leaking pretty heavily from the side that does *not* have the drain spigot. I bought it mostly for use in my backyard, so I'm not terribly mad, it still kept the ice cold for a long while. But I wouldn't trust it in my backseat, so warning: pretty leaky.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: keeps beverages cold
customer_reviews.text: Fits in our motor home bins below. Keeps the drinks very cold. don't let anyone sit on it, it squishes the gasket and ruins the seal. we learned the hard way. everyone wants to sit on it when it is out of the bin. these are not chairs people!!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. D.

customer_reviews.title: Ice maybe lasts 2 days.  Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this retro steel-belted cooler similar to one that I grew up camping with with my parents. These look nice, but are not the same. Ice does not keep for 4 days. In 70-80 degree weather, in the shade, I've had to replace ice in 2 days. This cooler will do for a day trip or an overnight trip or picnic....but for my family for camping for a week, you'd need to replace ice multiple times. I wouldb't buy again. And, the latch doesn't keep this locked/closed. My purchase on Amazon did not allow for me to exchange or return, so I just won't buy this one again or even recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Sturdy and keeps ice fir 4 days . Good value
customer_reviews.text: Love it . I bought it because it reminded me of when we were kids . Mom had one , they lasted forever . Plus kept ice from melting in cooler for 4 days So we love it . It’s sturdy has lock and keeps drinks cold and ice frozen . Great buy
customer_reviews.author: donna call

customer_reviews.title: nostalgic cooler, not quite as cool as it should be.
customer_reviews.text: if you're over 40, this is the cooler of your childhood. it's cool that it still exists, and it even works pretty well, but you won't get ice still frozen past a day or two. amazon sent mine loose in a giant box of paper scraps, so the paint job was jacked up, but it was structurally intact. either the valve or the valve seal leaks a bit; i'll try some silicone around the valve. it is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: harrow

customer_reviews.title: Rolls Royce of Coolers
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing product! I haven't seen something this well made it decades! I'm quite hefty and yet it has the capability of holding my weight. The water release valve is inset so that ALL the water can be released without tipping the box. The lock is very sturdy and not easily triggered open, but easy to open on purpose. Coleman has done a great job. Make sure you get the right one, though. They have a different one for less money that looks the same. I hear it isn't nearly as well made.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sackinger

customer_reviews.title: I purchased 2 of these. The classic green one ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these. The classic green one I still going strong. The stainless one fell apart the first summer. The insulated parts inside all cane loose, the seal didn’t hold and the handles fell off.
customer_reviews.author: Nick McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Best performing cooler I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler outperformed 4 other brands on a 5 day camping trip in hot weather! Love the square interior that provides more usable space and still had a 1/2 frozen bottle of water on the 5th day. Didn’t have to add any ice until the 3rd evening; while friends drained and added ice daily to their plastic coolers. I purchased this cooler after using one from the 1970’s and was so impressed I had to have one for myself. Durable, attractive and definitely keeps food and ice cold considerably longer than any other cooler I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Girl

customer_reviews.title: Ice melts in a couple hot days
customer_reviews.text: We keep this cooler in a thick wooden drawer in our van. We don't have A/C, so the van can get very warm. On hot days, a 7-lb bag of ice will melt completely in less than 48 hours, even being quick with grabbing items out and careful not to put anything inside until completely room temp. If in a cooler area, we've had the same size last about 3.5 days.
customer_reviews.author: ahaakonson2012

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler!
customer_reviews.text: For years I used one of the old style green aluminum Coleman coolers until my son somehow took possession. I ordered this one and I think it will last as long as my old one. Good quality and I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: David M Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Well made, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Love this cooler, steel shell with a thick black plastic bottom ensures that it will last a while. Made in the USA. Steel latching system, steel shell and steel handles, it screams durability. A channel inside that allows water to drain without tilting. Of course everyone knows red and black have to have the proper badge added. Going to add a bottle opener to the side like I’ve seen in other pictures this cooler appears in.
customer_reviews.author: vj1865

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for multi-day road trip!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a several day road trip with my family. Coupled with the cooler shock ice packs this cooler performed awesome. Sturdy enough keep in the middle of the van for extra shelf or sitting space while eating and big enough to hold multiple days worth of food for the family trip. The metal outside dents easy which is probably my only complaint. It didn't take much to leave some "parking lot" dings in the top and sides but doesn't hurt functionality at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Skippy

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Not as quality built as I’d hoped. Would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Retro style cooler that's great for camping
customer_reviews.text: Love this cooler, it's sturdy and a great size for travel, my only complaint is that the "lock" doesn't really secure the top it just makes it so it won't pop open but can be pulled open with some minimal force. Doesn't really matter as we always secure this with either bungee cords or other tie-downs for travel. Looks great and has a nice retro feel.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Y

customer_reviews.title: Retains cold temperatures well, light weight and roomy
customer_reviews.text: Just took this cooler on a road trip and extremely happy with the performance. We drove for 7 hours straight, lined the bottom of it with frozen water bottles and put food on top. Was surprised that the water was till frozen when we arrived at the destination, food nice and cool. It’s is light weight, durable and very roomy. Such a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marina G

customer_reviews.title: AVG cooler
customer_reviews.text: The price was right to purchase this cooler. Did well during my four day trip ....outside temp being over 95-110. Discovered that purchasing this oversize cooler and placing 30 can cooler made a big difference. No need for Y#t! brand.....just get a bigger cooler and small coolers inside ...or the foam disposable ones for 3.99
customer_reviews.author: Pangster

customer_reviews.title: latch does not work extremely disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this cooler - reminds me of our very first coleman... BUT the quality of the latch is awful - once you turn the latch and you think its lock you can just pull up on the lid and it comes up - the plastic latch is worthless - hoping they have a metal replacement I can put on in place of the plastic lock.
customer_reviews.author: CBF

customer_reviews.title: knew what I was getting into..
customer_reviews.text: Camping trip was coming up fast and I was running out of time. Nothing was in stock so I took what I could get. For the life of me, I can't understand why anyone would make a black cooler, but I needed one. With that said, it kept ice for about 3 days, covered with a white towel and kept in the shade. Average daytime temps were mid 80's F. Solid build and should last a long time. Not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Drain Plug
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I loved the retro look of the cooler. My first outing with it was on a road trip and when I arrived at my destination the back of my car was soaked. I assumed it was user error since it was brand new, and unplugged and plugged back in the drain plug. The next morning the camper we rented was also soaked with the melted ice water...the plug simply doesn't work. The road trip was just after my Amazon return window so I contacted Coleman directly through their website and have not heard back. TLDR; Defective cooler and zero customer service. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, fits a ton, and looks good too.
customer_reviews.text: Great! Fits a lot lot of food/beer (think +48pack beer + a full compliment of hotdogs for 12 people and condiments) + ice. Ice stayed frozen for +48hrs in 60F and sun. Not,only,does,it,work great, it also looks good, has a lockable latch, and is easy to carry. Great for car camping, picnics, or events. Not cheaply built or cheap looking either. If youre a cooler snob, you'll definitely get +1 points over the plastic/Styrofoam crowd.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wali

customer_reviews.title: Best little cooler I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best cooler I have ever owned. We had borrowed one from a friend and were so impressed we decided to buy one for ourselves. We recently took it on a trip from California to Wyoming. In the car for 3 days with ice and food. We still had nearly all of the ice when we arrived in Wyoming. In fact, we put what was left in the freezer at the hotel and used it on the way back. No need to pay up for a Yeti, this one works great!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Clark

customer_reviews.title: Leaks around drain
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a very nice cooler with a persistent flaw. It appears well built and sturdy, but the first time I used it, it leaked at the drain fitting. It wasn't leaking through the drain hole but rather between the fitting and the body of the cooler. I returned for a replacement which had the exact same problem. This one will be going back as well.
customer_reviews.author: Scarpa

customer_reviews.title: Attractive decoration, limited functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice but that’s about it. Went through 20 pounds of ice in about a day outside the sun in about 85 degree heat. Doesn’t lock shut because the lock is so cheaply made that even slight pressure will cause it to open. So if it tips everything is coming out even if the cooler is locked. Save your money and buy a cheap cooler or invest in something more durable that will actually keep cold.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this cooler for a camping trip.. This was kept inside of a cabin and the temp was approx. 85 outside. We had to replace the ice at a minimum of once daily.. It is NOT worth the $60.00.. Get the styrofoam coolers.. They work much better at a fraction of the price..
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L

customer_reviews.title: best cooler
customer_reviews.text: it wont keep ice as long as a yeti but it cost a lot less and will keep ice for several days and its also nice and light while having a solid build quality. i love the retro look as well. i actually prefer it to yeti for most applications. unless i need ice for more then a few days this is the go to cooler.
customer_reviews.author: loveliestmelody

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective, over priced, cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The item leaks, profoundly from the spout, Latch feature does not pull cooler closed it has a lot of give to it and must leak temperarure as well. I was excited to get this cooler it reminded me of one similarly used in a trip from 5 years ago. Very disapppointed in how this turned out. Will be requesting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: alex zwick

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as the original
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the only thing I can say I don't like about the cooler is the fact that the exterior is textured. And that's not a deal breaker. Cooler is very good sized and keeps stuff icy cold for an extremely long time. I think I should have gotten 2 because I can see my kids walking off with this one.
customer_reviews.author: aCoffeeJunky

customer_reviews.title: Not up to par with the old Coleman cooler.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with this item. I should have kept my old one and had it refurbished...didn't know I could. Latch will not last. Don't care for the finish on the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen S. Reekie

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I  just got a “bad one”  because Coldman makes the best cooler I think out there
customer_reviews.text: I have several Coleman coolers they are the marine one this is the best Coleman cooler I have ever Had as far as keeping ice cold and have only one problem is has a leaks around the outlet and stained the carpet in my new truck if not for the leak I would have given it five stars
customer_reviews.author: Eddie W

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler!
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade for us for sure. I was looking into the Yeti at first but when I saw it in person it didn't seem to be as high quality as I though t the price demanded. This cooler was great. Room to spare after storing food and beer needs for a family of four for three days. Everything was still really cold at the end. I put in bacon that wasn't frozen and when I went to use it on day 2 it was partially frozen!
customer_reviews.author: K. Wong

customer_reviews.title: I love the locking lid
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for myself at the local hardware store about 10 years ago, and it's holding up well (albeit with light usage) so I bought another to give to my son, who's been admiring it for all this time. I love the locking lid, and despite the sturdy construction it is still fairly light weight. It's also quite sleek and beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: KQ

customer_reviews.title: Retro Chiller is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This cooler was larger than I expected, 54 quarts is PLENTY for us, but it's not so big that you can't carry it. The metal handles are sturdy, it has a great retro look, and most importantly kept our brews and food cold for a minimum of 4 days! Not having to buy ice everyday was so awesome and it sat in a hot car the whole time and kept things nice a chill! So, skip the fancy over priced coolers if you want to spend less for a great product! We roll with a '67 Shasta retro trailer so, this cooler fit right in!
customer_reviews.author: Niccole Bayley

customer_reviews.title: Latch is useless- not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening, the latch doesn't work. If you leave it half done, it may stay closed if you don't touch it. Suggesting you should read reviews from other websites for accuracy before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra D

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cooler for the money. It seems to be well built and durable. The Color is very nice too. The cooler has plenty of room to store drinks and food for a weekend outing for sure. Certainly a buy recommendation for those not willing to shell out Bucks for an upper end Cooler like a Yeti. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Steve1

customer_reviews.title: Kept the food really cold on my 8 days of ...
customer_reviews.text: Kept the food really cold on my 8 days of camping. Average air temp was 80-85 degrees. I put in the shade with a rug over it. I would suggest using block ice over cubed as cubes melts much faster. I used this for vegetables and condiments that would spoil.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended, buy this Cooler!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic cooler!! Although it says “keeps ice up to 5 days,” I managed 8 when I had it out in the garage for a week! Very rugged and durable as well. Perhaps the biggest perk is that everyone loves this cooler!! You want a ton of compliments on your cooler? Don’t buy the Yeti buy this classic Coleman!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: the latch will not secure porperly
customer_reviews.text: the latch will not secure properly in the lock position, you are able to pull the lid open with a small amount of force, I took apart the strike on the lid and havnt come up with a solution of taking out the play the strike has with it secured on. Other than that It keeps ice cool, it is sturdy and very nice, I do recommend adding your own rubber gasket on the lid so when the lid is down no air can get in as the stock gasket leaves air gaps between the cooler and the lid. With a little DIY this can be the perfect cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Arrived pre-dented in several places.
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is large but not as sturdy as advertised. It arrived with three dents in the cooler already and the cooler dents very easily. I don't see that as doing anything other than cosmetic damage at this point. However due to this damage I would not put any weight on the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Not metal
customer_reviews.text: I bought the black matte and it is NOT metal. It's cheap plastic like most coleman coolers. Don't care if it works great, it's NOT what I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P. Hangey

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Measurements
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product based off the reviews and measurements provided by manufacturer. I had been looking for a cooler to fit on a mount in my trailer. With a family of 6, we need all the cooler space we can get so I was excited to find something that matched the measurements of the space on the trailer. I was extremely disappointed when the product arrived as it did not fit in the provided space. I returned to Amazon for a refund. The cooler itself seems like it would be great though.
customer_reviews.author: Eighmee

customer_reviews.title: Not the Good Old Days
customer_reviews.text: I remember my parents having the old, sturdy Coleman cooler. It was indestructible but heavy. This metal cooler is more for show. The metal case thin and easily dented. It is probably better than most other inexpensive coolers. It certainly is lighter than the old school one of my parents.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis of CA

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler, Bad Lock/Latch
customer_reviews.text: I love the cooler for the way it looks, how much it holds, and its ability to keep thing cool, HOWEVER, the lid easily pops open when the latch is on lock with not much effort (one hand). So, certainly not animal-proof, nor would the lid stay on if you knocked the cooler on its side with anything in it. I saw other reviewers addressing the broken lock as well and it’s definitely the weak point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Coleman cooler (1967), and bought this one as a gift for my girlfriend. First time camping with it, it held ice for around three days, with being opened about 20+ times a day. We are impressed and happy with it! Easy to clean, not very heavy, sturdy, and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Pins

customer_reviews.title: Verdict is still out
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in cooler weather, though I'm not sure food would last for the advertised days in direct sun. Already has a dent in the lid (only used three times), and the latch to close it has been unstable since receipt. Holds a decent amount of food though and works for what I need thus far.
customer_reviews.author: bbankcopa

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat a Coleman
customer_reviews.text: We’ve owned lots of coolers in our lifetime being an avid camper but this one by far is the best cooler we have ever had,holds ice for days, plenty of room inside for everything you need is somewhat heavy but that just let you know that it’s built real well that’s why it has two handles LOL I highly recommend this cooler it’s well worth the money in the long run 😀
customer_reviews.author: Susie Patterson

customer_reviews.title: If you want an 'old cooler' you're better off shopping yard sales
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool, looks sturdy, wanted to like it. But like others have said, the latch mechanism failed or pulls out, then no more closing the lid. Dumb design. Whoever designed this, should have just done what they did with the old latches. Disappointed that I spent over $100 for this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Antarctica

customer_reviews.title: Leaking
customer_reviews.text: Just received yesterday and the seal is leaking. I could never put this in the trunk of my car or take with me. 100.00 down the drain
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Torres

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Ice Chest is a Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: We decided to test this cooler out on arrival. Held ice well x 3 days so far. Sat on it (adult male - 160#s), no issue. Picked up & carried - fairly light weight; hubby says very light. Not going to toss it around & test THAT, but we are quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Aukele

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to go on a camping trip . I felt a metal cooler with a locking latch would be better than toe plastic coolers I already own However this weekend when I went camping I found The latch does not lock properly and the lid does not seal completely . I could have saved myself the money and used the igloo cooler under these conditions . Unfortunately I already discarded the box in which it was shipped
customer_reviews.author: james  holloran

customer_reviews.title: piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because is was similar to one I had years ago. Our first trip 3 weeks vac ice didnt last 5 hours in an air conditioned car. $100 worth of food novelties ruined. Coleman your product description is a lie. 4 days ?
customer_reviews.author: Dante

customer_reviews.title: for the money you would be hard pressed to find a better value.
customer_reviews.text: Held ice for nearly 2 days at a time while strapped to a trailer exposed to the sun and heat on a cross country summer trip. This is made very solid, for the money you would be hard pressed to find a better value.
customer_reviews.author: VAS Custom Rods

customer_reviews.title: Life changing cooler
customer_reviews.text: I frequently go camping, sometimes a week at a time, so getting a good quality cooler was definitely necessary for me. I used to use those regular cheap coolers you find at walmart or target and my ice would be completely melted after 24 hours. This cooler was my first time seeing ice last in a cooler for 3 days. Never had a yeti cooler but i dont think i would ever be interested in paying that much when this cooler does the job very well. Plus it looks really cool and you can even put magnets on it.
customer_reviews.author: anton

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler.
customer_reviews.text: We use it for the camping trips. It's been great, hold the items cold and ice does not melt for the long time. Size is good for two of us to bring enough food for two or three days. Very easy clean up, thank to a drain on the bottom. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ornela Beslagic

customer_reviews.title: I have two of these and love the looks
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and love the looks. But it surprises me how cheap and poorly made the clasp is that holds it closed. It’s partly made of plastic, and one tug when it’s “locked” rips the mechanism up and open. I expected better from Coleman. Also, where’s the bottle opener always found on the classic versions of these?
customer_reviews.author: T Martin Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Quality control?  Nope.
customer_reviews.text: So, just recieved my $130 cooler... dented in over a dozen places. Yes I understand I'm going to use it and it is probably going to get more, but if I spend money on a product, I would prefer it not to look like this straight from the box. Legit looks like ace ventura and HDS delivered it. Will update after use..
customer_reviews.author: Michael brasington

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: A little piece of nostalgia sitting on my front porch, a la Walt Kowalski. Holds plenty of beer, keeps it cold using one half-block of ice which lasts 4 days in the Oregon high desert this time of year. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: dogman

customer_reviews.title: Priced accordingly
customer_reviews.text: While the outer stainless shell is durable the cooler holds a 2 pack of ice for like 2 days. It starts to melt so if you want something with more insulation then spend more money. I lost a pack of Oscar Meyer bologna to the water when it sank in the cooler. I should have drained the water I suppose more frequently. I might try dry ice next time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For $100. The cooler latch fell apart
customer_reviews.text: I need a replacement I bought this in June but this is the second time using it at camp !! The latching mechanism came apart !! Very pissed as I paid near $100.00 for this cooler ! 906-360-9979 call me to care of this matter a pissed of costumer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Coleman Cooler | Steel-Belted Cooler Keeps Ice Up to 4 Days | 54-Quart Cooler for Camping, BBQs, Tailgating & Outdoor Activities
feature_bullets: High-capacity, heavy-duty cooler features a charming retro design
Keeps the Ice! insulation offers 4-day ice retention in temperatures as high as 90 degrees Fahrenheit
Built to deliver years of performance with rust-resistant stainless steel hardware
Comfort-grip steel handles allow for easy, controlled lifting and carrying

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
